programme.title: Sorry! Xmas '88
programme.desc: Special edition of the sitcom starring Ronnie Corbett. Timothy shows Mother, Father and Pippa round his new home, but Mother gets a chance to put Pippa off Timothy for life. S7 E5: Winter's Tale

programme.title: No Place Like Home Xmas 1984
programme.desc: Despite the fact that the Crabtrees decide to spend the festive season away, they all eventually realise that at Christmas time there is no place like home. S2 E9: Christmas At The Crabtrees

programme.title: No Place Like Home Xmas 1987
programme.desc: Arthur finds a large amount of cash that robbers left behind in a supermarket robbery. This sets off a moral dilemma involving back in favour prospective son in law Anthony. S5 E8: Local Hero

programme.title: Film: The Shop Around The Corner
programme.desc: Two gift shop employees (James Stewart & Margaret Sullavan) who can barely stand each other do not realise that they are falling in love through the post as each other's pen pal. Romance. 1940 (U)

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Sitcom about in-laws forced to share a flat below their children, who have just become parents. Money is very tight, but Nick's father has an idea. S1 E1: Your Place or Mine

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Domestic sitcom. Sam and Daphne's life of enforced domesticity in the basement is further complicated by an unexpected visitor. S1 E2: Widower's Mite

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Domestic sitcom. Sam and Daphne's enforced flat-share is just a few weeks old, but already Daphne is forced to include Sam in her social life. S1 E3: Ill Wind from Cheltenham

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Sitcom about in-laws forced to share a flat. Daphne finds it difficult to improve her social life with Sam around. S1 E4: Epping's Not Far

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Sitcom about flat-sharing in-laws, whose children have just had their first baby. Sam is envious when Daphne acquires an antique. S1 E5: Just Desserts

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Sitcom about in-laws forced to share a flat. Daphne is at the end of her tether and feels the time is right for some hard bargaining, but will Sam cooperate? S1 E6: Two Down, One to Go

programme.title: Three Up, Two Down
programme.desc: Sitcom about in-laws forced to share a flat below their children. Daphne looks forward to finding a kindred spirit in her new neighbour. S2 E1: Major Inconvenience

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em Xmas 74
programme.desc: Classic sitcom about walking disaster Frank Spencer (Michal Crawford). Frank and Betty are looking forward to Christmas, especially the church's Nativity play. Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em: S2 E7

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em Xmas 75
programme.desc: Classic sitcom starring Michael Crawford as the hapless Frank Spencer. As Christmas approaches, Frank takes just one more lesson before yet another driving test. Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em: S2 E8

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em Xmas 78
programme.desc: Frank Spencer's grandfather pays for flying lessons so that Frank can help on his Australian sheep farm. Betty doesn't think it's a good idea, nor does the flying instructor. Stars Michael Crawford.

programme.title: Steptoe and Son Xmas 1973
programme.desc: Albert is looking forward to another family Christmas, but Harold wants to go to Majorca and put his father in a home for the duration. Stars Harry H Corbett and Wilfrid Brambell. S7 E8: The Party

programme.title: Steptoe and Son Xmas 1974
programme.desc: Harold wants to go to Switzerland for Christmas whilst Albert - as usual - prefers Bognor; he is persuaded to go provided they sail rather than fly. S8 E7: A Perfect Christmas

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Love and anticipation are in the air at the Solana as Joyce and Monty's wedding day arrives. However, when things go awry at the wedding on Peacock Island, Kenneth volunteers to save the day. S10 E1

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Ian gets caught up with someone on the run, Karen and Jamie try to out-do each other, and Mimi Maguire causes concern when she stops speaking. S4 E4

programme.title: Never the Twain Xmas 89
programme.desc: It's the season of goodwill, and Simon and Oliver volunteer to keep watch overnight in the local church. Special edition of the sitcom starring Windsor Davies and Donald Sinden. S9 E7: A Winter's Tale

programme.title: Robin's Nest Xmas '79

programme.title: Home to Roost Xmas 87
programme.desc: Henry plans an intimate Yuletide break with his girlfriend Cynthia, but his children then land on the doorstep wanting a family Christmas. S3 E8: Family Ties

programme.title: Tommy Cooper Xmas 1973
programme.desc: Christmas Special which sees Tommy carol singing, golfing on a snooker table and attempting to cook a duck. Music is provided by Clodagh Rogers and Sacha Distel.

programme.title: Krays: The Men Behind the Myth
programme.desc: Ronnie and Reggie Kray came from humble beginnings to become the UK's most notorious and feared criminals. We look at how they built and ran their criminal empire before being brought to justice.

programme.title: Bread Xmas 1988

programme.title: Bread Xmas 1989

programme.title: Bread Xmas 1990
programme.desc: While the rest of the Boswells are oblivious, Nellie discovers that it's the tiny things in life which can create the biggest dilemmas. Christmas special 1990.

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: The wedding party gets back after a messy night out with no sign of Kenneth, only for Jacqueline's concern to turn to joy when he turns up after 'the night of his life.' S10 E2

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Debbie's enjoying having her dad back in the house, but when Monica gets jealous of the attention Debbie's getting, she tells her it's time she got a boyfriend. S4 E5

programme.desc: When Joyce appoints Monty as the new Entertainment Manager, he plans a magical evening at Neptune's, with guest stars the Chuckle Brothers. Meanwhile, the Dawsons speculate further about Cyd. S10 E3

programme.desc: Carl wants his family back together and that means getting rid of Norma - for good. Meanwhile, Frank agrees to work on Shane's ice cream van. But there's trouble brewing. S4 E6

programme.title: Worst Xmas Of My Life

programme.title: New: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the hapless Mr. Bean. In this original award-winning episode, he takes an exam, sunbathes and goes to church with Richard Briers. Ep1: Mr. Bean

programme.title: New: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean turns the most ordinary situations into moments of excruciating embarrassment as he visits a department store and gets carried away. E2: The Return of Mr. Bean

programme.title: New: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean goes to a swimming pool but struggles with the diving board, attempts to leave a car park in style and demonstrates some sandwich-making. E3: The Curse of Mr. Bean

programme.title: New: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean buys a TV and a new camera but has issues with both; meanwhile, he ends up in another pickle when he goes to a magic show and a disco. E4: Mr. Bean Goes to Town

programme.title: New: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean gets to an appointment with the dentist after oversleeping and has trouble in the park with a bothersome fly. E5: The Trouble with Mr. Bean

programme.title: New: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson creates more comic mayhem as Mr. Bean comes to the aid of a heart attack victim, fails miserably to post a letter, and flies off on holiday. E6: Mr. Bean Rides Again

programme.title: Film: Miracle on 34th Street

programme.title: Up Pompeii!
programme.desc: Frankie Howerd plays Lurcio the slave in mid-70s BC Pompeii. Lurcio has to help his master Ludicrus Sextus find a virgin for the annual vestal virgin festival. S1 E1: Vestal Virgins

programme.title: Up Pompeii!
programme.desc: Frankie Howerd plays Lurcio the slave in mid-70s B.C. Pompeii in the classic series. Lurcio has been ordered by his master to assassinate Caesar, but are we seeing double? S1 E2: The Ides of March

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the hapless Mr. Bean. In this original award-winning episode, he takes an exam, sunbathes and goes to church with Richard Briers. Ep1: Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean turns the most ordinary situations into moments of excruciating embarrassment as he visits a department store and gets carried away. E2: The Return of Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean goes to a swimming pool but struggles with the diving board, attempts to leave a car park in style and demonstrates some sandwich-making. E3: The Curse of Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean buys a TV and a new camera but has issues with both; meanwhile, he ends up in another pickle when he goes to a magic show and a disco. E4: Mr. Bean Goes to Town

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean gets to an appointment with the dentist after oversleeping and has trouble in the park with a bothersome fly. E5: The Trouble with Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson creates more comic mayhem as Mr. Bean comes to the aid of a heart attack victim, fails miserably to post a letter, and flies off on holiday. E6: Mr. Bean Rides Again

programme.title: Mr. Bean Xmas 1992
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wreaks havoc at Harrods when he goes Christmas shopping, then has trouble stuffing a turkey on Christmas Day. E7: Merry Christmas, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: More hilarious mishaps with the bumbling Mr. Bean, this time as he books into a hotel room and makes himself well and truly at home but locks himself out. E8: Mr. Bean in Room 426

programme.title: Mr. Bean New Year
programme.desc: Mr. Bean loses midnight on New Year's Eve, devises an unusual method of transporting his sales shopping home, and wreaks havoc by doing a spot of decorating. E9: Do-It-Yourself, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean goes to the funfair and ends up having to watch over a baby; will the mother find them in time? E10: Mind the Baby, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: When the hapless bumbler Mr. Bean goes back to school, he scares a boy in the chemistry lab and the nudes in the art class cause him to look at the floor. E11: Back to School, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: It turns our that Mr. Bean isn't very good at looking after things in a laundrette, and he later has difficulty keeping control of his ball during a round of mini golf. E12: Tee Off, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: More mayhem with hapless bumbler Mr. Bean as he struggles to wait in line for an appointment and thinks up some unusual methods to help him sleep. E13: Goodnight Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: The blunderingly inept master of disaster goes for a haircut - but ends up styling the other customers' hair - and causes chaos at a school fun day. E14: Hair by Mr. Bean of London

programme.title: Likely Lads: No Hiding Place
programme.desc: Bob and Terry are desperate not to know the result of the England v Bulgaria football match, but will they succeed in their mission with eight hours to go? S1 E7: No Hiding Place

programme.title: Bread Xmas 1988
programme.desc: The Boswell clan go on holiday to Rome, and their trip inspires some happy memories and new friendships with Nellie especially happy to be in the Eternal City. Christmas Special 1988

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: When Noreen and Pauline return to the Solana, Pauline's writer's block disappears on finding her muse - meanwhile, Monty is worried about Sammy, but how can he lose 'the fear'? S10 E5

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Learning of the death of his ex-cellmates is sending Paddy round the bend. Three of them have been taken out in suspicious circumstances: could this mean he's next?. S4 E8

programme.title: In Sickness Xmas 1985
programme.desc: 1985 Christmas special. Alf schemes so they can attend two Christmas dinners. Rita is forced to stay.
